prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A pianist who can't play a lick. Formerly an ace defense attorney of some renown.
Character 1
Name: Trucy Enigmar → Trucy Wright
Description: Future star magician, and Phoenix Wright's daughter. Fond of her Mr. Hat trick.
Character 2
Name: Vera Misham
Description: My client, apparently. I know nothing other than her name and mailing address.
Character 3
Name: Ema Skye
Description: Detective obsessed with forensics. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Drew Misham
Description: Painter known for his illustrations. Poisoned at Drew Studio.
Character 5
Name: Valant Gramarye
Description: Popular stage magician. His overly loquacious manner can get annoying.
Character 6
Name: Spark Brushel
Description: Freelance journalist. Can smell a scoop from miles away.
Character 7
Name: Klavier Gavin
Description: Star prosecutor and leader/vocalist for the rock group, the Gavinners.
Character 8
Name: Shadi Enigmar → Zak Gramarye
Description: My client in this case. Usually goes by his stage name, "Zak Gramarye".
Character 9
Name: Magnifi Gramarye
Description: The victim in this case. Died after being shot in the head while in the hospital.
Character 10
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 11
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: A greenhorn defense attorney I happened to meet. I call him Apollo.
Character 12
Name: Kristoph Gavin
Description: Incarcerated at the Central Penitentiary for the murder of Shadi Smith.
Character 13
Name: Thalassa Gramarye
Description: Trucy's mother. Still missing after her sudden disappearance.
Character 14
Name: Mike Meekins
Description: Bailiff responsible for security at the trial where Zak Gramarye vanished.
Character 15
Name: Shadi Smith
Description: In reality, the magician Zak. Murdered at Russian eatery: the Borscht Bowl Club.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Magic Show Ticket
Description: For premier showing of a grand illusion, to be performed by the magician, Valant Gramarye.
Evidence 2
Name: Gramarye Envelope
Description: Envelope from Mr. Wright. Do not open until the time is right.
Evidence 3
Name: Vera's Card
Description: Defendant's business card. The address for Drew Studio is on the front.
Evidence 4
Name: Portrait
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. That bit in the middle is supposed to be a person.
Evidence 5
Name: Acrylic
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. An undersea scene in vivid colors.
Evidence 6
Name: Landscape
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. Only half finished, the rough sketch is still visible.
Evidence 7
Name: Coffee Mug
Description: The victim's last mug of coffee. The scrawl on the side is Drew Misham's signature. Traces of the slow-acting deadly poison atroquinine were found on the rim.
Evidence 8
Name: Hidden Painting
Description: Found at Drew Studio. Notable for the large peach in the foreground.
Evidence 9
Name: Red Envelope
Description: Found in the victim's desk drawer. Appears to have been opened once and resealed. Found in the victim's desk drawer. Contains two sheets of writing paper.
Evidence 10
Name: Letter Box
Description: Drew Misham's contact with the outside world. It's empty.
Evidence 11
Name: Tiny Frame
Description: Frame measuring two inches by two inches. Bears traces of deadly poison atroquinine.
Evidence 12
Name: Brushel's Card
Description: This business card reads "Spark Brushel, Freelance Journalist".
Evidence 13
Name: Misham's Autopsy Report
Description: Death by atroquinine poisoning. Estimated time of death: 9:00-9:30 PM.
Evidence 14
Name: Crime Photo
Description: Body found in hospital room, shot in the forehead. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Magnifi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: single gunshot to the head. Estimated time of death: 11:00-11:30 PM.
Evidence 16
Name: Notebook Page
Description: Mysterious paper received just before the trial. Click here for details. Forged to look like a page of Magnifi's diary. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: Magnifi's Chart
Description: Diagnosed with a malignant tumor. Given 3 months. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Small Syringe
Description: Used for administering insulin shots. Has been washed and shows no sign of use.
Evidence 19
Name: Magnifi's Letter
Description: Letter asking Zak to shoot him. Click here for details.
Evidence 20
Name: Stage Pistol
Description: Fires one real bullet. Rifling marks match bullet found in victim. No fingerprints found.
Evidence 21
Name: Magnifi's Letter 2
Description: Letter telling Valant to come at 11:20 PM. Click here for details.
Evidence 22
Name: IV Report
Description: IV stopped 10 min. after administration began. Click here for details.
Evidence 23
Name: Magnifi's Diary
Description: A memoir of sorts. Written in up to just before he died.
Evidence 24
Name: The Amazing Mr. Hat
Description: Trucy's favorite trick. Startlingly realistic.
Evidence 25
Name: Trucy's Locket
Description: Contains a photo of Trucy's mother, Thalassa.
Evidence 26
Name: Transferal of Rights
Description: Document tranferring the right to perform the Gramarye repertoire to daughter Trucy.
Evidence 27
Name: Nail Polish
Description: Retrieved from Kristoph Gavin's cell. The nail polish is colorless.
Evidence 28
Name: Commemorative Stamp
Description: Commemorative stamp showing Troupe Gramarye. Click here for details. Sent from the real "client". Click here for details.
Evidence 29
Name: Thalassa's Portrait
Description: Photo of a young Thalassa, Trucy's mother. Click here for details.
Evidence 30
Name: Zak's Confession
Description: Confession to the slaying of Magnifi Gramarye. Click here for details.
Evidence 31
Name: Letter from Misham
Description: Letter posted by Drew Misham just before dying. Poison traces found on the stamp.
Evidence 32
Name: Letter from Mr. Wright
Description: Reproduction of information found by Mr. Wright during his investigation.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Actually... the victim kind of ordered the defendant to do him in.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: A few days before it happened, the victim sent a letter "ordering" his own murder.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: The defendant did what was asked of him, and shot the old man in the forehead!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The bullet was fired from the pistol found at the scene, no doubt about it.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: And the pistol definitely belonged to the old man, sir!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 5
Testimony: So what if he shot the clown? He still shot the victim, pal!
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 20 (Stage Pistol): It states that no fingerprints were found on the stage pistol that fired the bullet that killed the victim (Magnifi Gramarye). 

Testimony 3 (Gumshoe): The testimony suggests certainty that the bullet was fired from the pistol found at the scene. However, it does not contradict the evidence that no fingerprints were found, so this is not a contradiction pair.

Looking further:

Testimony 0 states the victim ordered the defendant to kill him.

Testimony 1 also supports this with the victim sending a letter ordering his own murder.

Evidence 19 (Magnifi's Letter) is a letter asking Zak to shoot him.

Testimony 2 states the defendant did what was asked.

No contradiction here.

Testimony 4 says the pistol belonged to the victim, and evidence 20 states the stage pistol was found at the scene, presumably the victim’s.

Testimony 5: "So what if he shot the clown? He still shot the victim, pal!"

"Clown" likely refers to "Zak Gramarye" (Shadi Enigmar), who used the stage name Zak Gramarye, possibly seen as a "clown" here. 

Looking for evidence about Zak shooting the victim: There is evidence that Zak (Shadi Smith) is the defendant and was the shooter. But a contradiction arises if the victim ordered his murder and then the defendant is accused.

But focusing on evidence and testimony contradictions:

The Mug (Evidence 7) shows traces of atroquinine poison on the rim.

Evidence 13 states the cause of death of Drew Misham was atroquinine poisoning, time of death 9:00-9:30 PM.

Meanwhile, Evidence 15 (Magnifi's Autopsy Report) says the cause of death was single gunshot to the head at 11:00-11:30 PM.

This shows the victim died from gunshot, but another person (Drew Misham) died earlier from poison.

Any testimony about poisoning contradicts testimony about gunshot being cause of death?

Testimony 3 says bullet was from the pistol and caused death, matches evidence.

No contradiction there.

Evidence 31 (Letter from Misham) has poison on stamp.

Maybe someone poisoned Misham via letter.

Testimony 0-2 refer to the shooting.

No direct contradiction detected here.

Review evidence 18 (Small Syringe): Used for insulin shots, washed.

No testimonies mention insulin.

Not a contradiction.

Evidence 28 (Commemorative Stamp) sent from real client.

No testimony about this.

Evidence 27 (Nail Polish) from Kristoph's cell is colorless.

No testimony about that.

Evidence 16 (Notebook Page) is a forged page of Magnifi’s diary.

No testimony about forgery.

Therefore, no direct contradiction detected except possibly with testimony 3 and evidence 20:

Testimony 3: "The bullet was fired from the pistol found at the scene, no doubt about it."

Evidence 20: "No fingerprints found."

Gumshoe's certainty would be undermined if the pistol had no fingerprints at all, possibly indicating someone else fired it with gloves or another person did it.

Hence, puzzling but not an outright contradiction.

Alternatively, see this:

Testimony 0: Victim ordered defendant to kill him.

Evidence 30 (Zak's Confession): Confession to slaying Magnifi Gramarye.

If Zak is the defendant.

No contradiction.

Testimony 1: Victim sent letter ordering his own murder.

Evidence 19: Letter asking Zak to shoot him.

No contradiction.

Therefore, no opposition here.

In the data, there is one more possible pair:

Testimony 3 says the bullet was fired from the pistol found at the scene beyond doubt.

Evidence 20 says no fingerprints found on pistol.

No direct contradiction, but absence of fingerprints might question identity of shooter.

Alternatively, consider Testimony 5:

"So what if he shot the clown? He still shot the victim, pal!"

This implies the shooter also shot the clown.

Evidence says magnifi was shot and killed; Shadi Smith aka Zak was the defendant.

Not a contradiction.

Hence, the best and only possible contradiction pair is:

Evidence 20: No fingerprints on pistol.

Testimony 3: Confidently says the bullet was fired from the pistol found at the scene, implying culpability.

This is a minor contradiction about definitiveness of shooter because no fingerprints means no direct physical evidence of shooter.

Therefore:
